newsitem.title: JAPAN: HANDBALL-FORMER ROMANIAN COACH KUNSZT DIES.
newsitem.headline: HANDBALL-FORMER ROMANIAN COACH KUNSZT DIES.

text.p: Ioan Kunszt-Ghermanescu, former head coach of the Romanian handball team and an honorary member of the International Handball Federation (IHF), died on Thursday of a heart attack, an IHF spokesman announced.
The 72-year-old Romanian was found dead in his hotel room in Kumamoto where he was attending the men's World Championships.
Kunszt coached the Romanian teams which won the 1961, 1964 and 1970 world championships.
Before the start of each of Thursday's quarter-final matches, a minute's silence was observed in his honour.
